key_points: Jean Lafitte and surrounding areas in south Jefferson Parish are experiencing catastrophic flooding due to Hurricane Ida.
Hundreds of residents are unable to be reached with reports of floodwater between 10 to 12 feet.
Police Chief Marcel Rodriguez estimates at least 400 people stayed behind, unable to evacuate due to financial or physical reasons.
Search and rescue efforts are hindered by the severe conditions but ongoing.
The situation is being compared to, and in some aspects considered worse than, Hurricane Katrina 16 years prior.
Residents who stayed are in panic mode, feeling trapped with some in homes that are decades old and now amidst severe flooding.
State assistance from the National Guard and FEMA has been requested, but immediate help is hampered by the ongoing severe conditions.
Chief Rodriguez is receiving updates from deputies and the National Weather Service but unable to provide immediate assistance.
This event marks the 16th anniversary of Hurricane Katrina, drawing eerie parallels but with potentially worse outcomes for the area.
Chief Rodriguez and others call for prayers for those affected, worrying especially about those without insurance.
spokespersons: Jason Leorwald (Sergeant, Jean Lafitte Police Department)
